knot.line: I love this movie. This won the Oscar didn't it?
<turns off the movie and switches it to the local news, which his mom co-anchors for>
Ghandi. Spielberg was robbed. This was before he outgrew his Peter Pan syndrome.
But Ghandi? I mean why give an Oscar to a movie you can't even sit through?
Must weigh a lot. How does she walk upright?
Come on you always spend the night.
I just don't think it's a good idea for me to sleep over anymore, you know?
No, I don't know. C'mon, You've been sleeping over since you were seven. It's Saturday night.
Sleeping in the same bed was fine when we were kids, but we're fifteen now.
Whoa Jo, don't hit and run. C'mon, explain yourself.
I just think our emerging hormones are destined to alter our relationship and I'm trying to limit the fallout.
Your emerging hormones aren't developing a thang for me, are they?
No, I'm not getting a thing for you Dawson. I've known you too long. I've seen you burp, barf, pick your nose, scratch your butt. I don't think I'm getting a thing for you.
We're changing and we have to adjust or else the male/female thing will get in the way.
What's with this When Harry met 80's crap. It doesn't apply to us, we transcend it.
And how do we do that?
By going to sleep. I'm tired.
No, it's proof. Proof that we can still remain friends, despite any mounting sexual theoretics.
I don't think it works that way Dawson.
Come on, don't get female on me Joey. I don't want to have to start calling you Josephine.
We're friends okay? No matter how much body hair we acquire? Deal?
All right...and we don't ever talk about this again, deal?
Why'd you have to bring this up anyway?
